https://shiny.gmw.rug.nl/ggplotgui/

Load ggplot2 into R environment:
```{r}
library("ggplot2")
```

Load the dataframe into R environment:
```{r}
data(mpg)
```

Call the function passing a dataset:
```{r}
ggplot_shiny(mpg) # Passing ggplot's mpg dataset
```

```{r}
# The code below will generate the graph:
graph <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = manufacturer, y = hwy, colour = manufacturer)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch = FALSE) +
  geom_jitter(size = 1, alpha = 0.5, width = 0.25, colour = 'black') +
  labs(x = 'Car Brand', y = 'Highway MPG') +
  ggtitle('Car Brands and Highway MPG')+
  labs(colour = 'title legend') +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
    legend.position = 'right'
  )
graph
```

```{r}
# If you want the plot to be interactive,
# you need the following package(s):
library("plotly")
ggplotly(graph)
```
